message: Anyone seen anything new and exciting in this realm in a while? Had a good conversation with someone today about some ideas regarding monitoring large server setups and the applications that run on them. Curious if anyone has seen any new ideas here.
Zed Shaw had an intriguing idea about doing statistical analysis of /proc data. Sounded interesting but I don't think there's any code yet.
@davisp in a tweet? I may track that down to see if he commented around it...
Pretty sure it was a tweet. Might not have been more than one though
@davisp yeah I found it. A couple of tweets, looking at /proc delta's for interesting behavior.
Yeah, that's about all I remember
There's always CloudKick, which means you don't have to set anything up, haha
Rails had something cool that mucked around with /proc
It was a hosted thing. You installed a gem, added it to your project, and it could map individual requests to increases in CPU usage, etc.
@ericflo Honestly, not as impressed with Cloudkick after using them for a bit.
@justinlilly Well, I meant more for an internal setup, though New Relic is really good and I can't wait for their Python support.
